name: Amazing Movie Stars 3 Quiz | Celebrities | 25 Questions

questions.text: This American actor became a minor league baseball star in the 1970s. In a television movie he made a striking impersonation of Elvis Presley and for years has lived with Goldie Hawn, with whom he has a son.
This American actor once performed as a club comic. 'Night Shift' was his debut film and his real name is Michael Douglas. He has played 'Batman' in two big-budget films.
This British actor was jetted to international stardom with the film 'Four Weddings and a Funeral'. He had lived with actress Elizabeth Hurley for thirteen years before parting in 2000.
questions.explanation:
Hugh Grant.

	He was educated at Oxford University and he started his career on stage as a comedian.

questions.text: This American actress graduated to pin-up roles and was married to Roger Vadim. She was known for her anti-Vietnam War views and is the daughter of a famous acting father.
questions.explanation:
Jane Fonda.

	Her father was Henry Fonda.

questions.text: This grey-haired American actor was a former nightclub comedian who is best at playing silly, vulgar or endearing roles. He married and divorced actress Victoria Tennant.

Who is the American actor who became Hollywood's hottest box-office hit following back-to-back best actor Academy Awards (the first since Spencer Tracy in 1937-38 with 'Captains Courageous' and 'Boys' Town')?
questions.explanation:
Tom Hanks.

	'Philadelphia' and 'Forrest Gump' were his back-to-back Academy Awards.

questions.text: This dancing and singing American actor was Hollywood's highest paid actor by 1995. He married actress Kelly Preston.

This Italian glamour girl and international leading lady was never accused of overacting as it was debatable whether she ever acted at all playing mindless, plastic beauties. She was nationally known as 'La lollo'.
This India-born British actress played 'Bathsheba' in 'Far from the Madding Crowd' and won an Oscar for her performance in 'Darling'.

She was America's top star from 1935-38. She couldn't really sing but did so delightfully and she danced with the confidence of Gene Kelly. She became American ambassador to Ghana and later to Czechoslovakia.
American actor who has written screenplays and occasionally directs. He's played loners imbued with self-dislike and he won his third Oscar for 'As Good as it Gets'.
questions.explanation:
Jack Nicholson.

	He won Academy Awards for 'One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest' and 'Terms of Endearment'

questions.text: This star's legs were supposedly insured for millions of dollars with Lloyds of London and made her queen of World War Two pin-ups. She married Jackie Coogan (1937-1940).

This American actress founded her own production company in 1991, Egg Pictures, and began directing her first film at 29. Before she was fourteen she had played a gangster's moll, a murderess, and a prostitute.
This American actor-director married and divorced Rita Hayworth, his second of three wives. In 1938 he panicked the whole of America with a vivid radio version of 'The War of the Worlds'.
questions.explanation:
Orson Welles.

	Films he directed included Citizen Kane (1941).

questions.text: This American actress was on the verge of stardom for 25 years without becoming a major attraction. She won an Academy Award nomination as the wronged wife in 'Fatal Attraction'.

This American actor's son was killed in an air crash in 1987. He became one of Hollywood's top box-office attractions in films between 1958-65 having quit as a straight man in a comedy partnership lasting from 1946-57.
questions.explanation:
Dean Martin.

	His comedy partner was Jerry Lewis.

questions.text: This American entertainer grew up in Honolulu, Hawaii. She was permitted to use her Mae West-style personality to steal scenes in films not specifically tailored to her.
This British actress was a talented singer who was in stage musicals as a teenager. She has never been afraid of nudity and 'Heavenly Creatures' (1994) was her debut film.
This Swaziland-born actor had the surname Esterhuysen. He was seen in the film Pret-a-Porter whose American version was called 'Ready to Wear'.
Amazingly this British-born Hollywood star never won an Oscar although he was given an honorary one in 1969. He originally went to America as an acrobat and died following a stroke in 1986.

American actress who was a top model for years before switching to acting at the age of 35. During the 1990s she co-starred with Clint Eastwood, Kevin Costner, Dustin Hoffman, Mel Gibson and John Travolta.
Which Irish-born actor was nominated eight times, but did not win an Academy Award?
questions.explanation:
Peter O'Toole.

	Nominations were for 'Lawrence of Arabia', 'Becket', 'The Lion in Winter', 'Goodbye Mr. Chips', 'The Ruling Class', 'The Stuntman', 'My Favorite Year', and 'Venus'.

questions.text: This Tasmanian-born star was a renowned womaniser on and off the screen. Even after dying from a heart attack in 1959, he was accused of being a Nazi spy and IRA supporter.
This six-times married red-haired British comedian was fired more than once by his long-time boss, Hal Roach. He had director credits on some of his films.
questions.explanation:
Stan Laurel.

	We mainly see him in black and white movies, so the red hair is surprising.

questions.text: This seven-time married American actress had a fourteen-year-old daughter, Cheryl.  Cheryl stabbed her mother's lover, Johnny Stompanato, to death in the mother's bedroom in a Beverly Hills mansion when he threatened to cut her mother up.  Who was Cheryl's mother?
questions.explanation:
Lana Turner.

	She was known as the 'Sweater Girl'. Hope you enjoyed the quiz and learnt something new.
